headline: Steve Bannon panics as Trump's attempt to beat Brian Kemp flops: 'Why is Perdue 27 points down?!'
author: Brad Reed
sentences: Bossie then speculated about what Perdue could do to get himself back into the race, and he said he needed to convince Georgia Republicans that Kemp failed to stop Trump's 2020 election loss in the Peach State because he's supposedly scared of Democrat Stacey Abrams.

Trump blames Kemp and Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger for his loss in Georgia, and he even called Raffensperger in the days leading up to the January 6th Capitol riots and asked him to "find" enough votes so that he could be declared the winner.

Discussing the poll on his "War Room" podcast, Bannon asked right-wing operative David Bossie how Perdue could be getting whipped this badly despite having former President Donald Trump's full endorsement.
Trump ally Steve Bannon hit the panic button this week after seeing a poll that shows Trump-backed Georgia gubernatorial candidate David Perdue losing badly to incumbent Brian Kemp.

I saw the same poll you did - I\u2019m shocked.\u201dpic.twitter.com/doLUos7SbZ
 Ron Filipkowski \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\udde6 (@Ron Filipkowski \ud83c\uddfa\ud83c\udde6) 1651182072
Bannon is trying to figure out how David Perdue can be 27 points down in GA with Trump\u2019s endorsement.
Guest says it\u2019s because he isn\u2019t talking about \u2018election fraud\u2019 enough.
"As an observer, it looks like Perdue has been a lackluster campaigner," Bossie replied.
"Hopefully in the closing weeks hes going to pull things out," said Bossie.
\u201cHopefully in the closing weeks he\u2019s going to pull things out.
"The first time he took the gloves off, literally two nights ago.
"I saw the same poll you did -- Im shocked."
"Why is Perdue 27 points down on Kemp?!"
It's a little late in the game!"
